description:
I remember playing this when I was a kid. It was ok even back then. But today, with Steam allow us to play actual SM CIv games on Linux this has no point other than being a Free "version" of the same basic premises. 

In addition, the game has not kept up with the times and it can be attributed to the failure of the concept of "Open Source" not working in the area of Video Games. For-profit VG developers have a saying, "At some point, you must ship" meaning at some point the game needs to be declared finished and submitted for the market's approval or disapproval. Freeciv sadly has remained in what feels like an Beta if not late Alpha stage for over a decade if not two. It is highly likely major innovation/overhaul needs to happen for the game to be relevant in today's gaming space, or needs to be put down.

The lettering is small and I couldn't make it bigger. Worse the letter colors make them almost invisible. I couldn't change the colors. The pyramid doesn't work the same as in the original game. The special resources have different meanings and the help screen doesn't explain much. Research is so slow I final just deleted the game as more trouble to relearn than it is worth.
summary: Great game but hard to see

description: Freeciv (or Civilization) is pretty much the ultimate grand strategy game. I mean, the graphics could be a little better, but overall I loved it. 5/5 stars.
I played this game for decades and still enjoy it like the first day. Great to see it still has an active community updating and polishing this wonderfull game. Keep up the good work.
He jugado juegos de estrategia por turnos que me resultaron muy adictivos pero en este juego los controles son irritantemente trabajosos. Desinstalado.
